info.description: Relational Database of Metabolic Pathways (RaMP) API
info.title: RaMP API v1.0.1

tags.name: biochemical-pathways
tags.description: Users can retrieve analytes from input pathways, retrieve pathways from input analytes, as well as perform multi-omic pathway enrichment. RaMP-DB pulls from pathway information from multiple resources, including HMDB, Reactome, WikiPathways, and PFOCR.

tags.name: ontologies
tags.description: RaMP-DB contains ontology annotations, obtained from HMDB, which include the following categories: Biofluid and excreta, Organ and components, Subcellular location, Industrial applications, Source (e.g. plant/animal/microbial), Health Condition, Tissue and substructures. Search for information on ontologies and perform enrichment analysis.  Ontologies included describe metabolites only.

tags.name: reactions
tags.description:
RaMP-DB pulls reaction information from the curated resource Rhea and HMDB. Only human reactions are retrieved. The information retrieved includes reaction classes, information on substrates and products, their enzymes (if any) as well as directionality. Both enzymatic and spontaneous biotransformations are represented.
The following analytes involving reactions can be performed: retrieving analytes involved in the same reaction and visualizing associated networks, retrieve and interactively explore reaction classes and perform enrichment.

tags.name: chemical-descriptors
tags.description: Retrieve chemical classes (Classyfire and lipidMAPS) and chemical property information from input metabolites, as well as perform chemical class enrichment.

tags.name: identifier-harmonization
tags.description: Uses MetLinkR R package to automatically cross-link metabolite identifiers across multiple studies and attribute them a common name. MetLinkR runs in minutes and allows for simultaneous querying of 6 commonly reported identifier types. It is recommended that users inspect outputs to ensure that mappings maintain the desired level of chemical structural resolution.

tags.name: enrichment-results-tools
tags.description: Filter and/or cluster the results of enrichment tests

get.summary: Return source version information. Includes RaMP version number, source database versions, and other metadata
Return valid RaMP-DB database prefixes for genes and metabolites (e.g. 'hmdb:', 'kegg:')
Return association counts for different RaMP-DB data types, broken down by source database (chemical properties, pathway associations, gene/metabolite/pathway counts)
Return redundancy of source databases. Lists counts of identical analytes pulled from source databases.

parameters.name: analytetype
parameters.description: specifies type of analyte intersects to return, 'metabolites' or 'genes'

get.summary: Return all metabolite ontologies present in RaMP-DB, including ontology category (e.g. 'Health condition', 'Biofluid and excreta', etc.)
Return chemical class levels present in RaMP-DB (e.g. sub-class, super-class)

requestBody.description: Retrieve pathway(s) from input analyte(s).  Prepend IDs by source ID type (e.g. hmdb:HMDB0240254).
Retrieve analytes belonging to input pathways.  Names of pathways can be input.

pathway.description: a string or a vector of strings that contains pathways of interest

analyteType.description: a string denoting the type of analyte to return ("gene", "metabolite", "both")

match.description: type of matching to use, options are "exact" or "fuzzy". The default is "fuzzy".

namesOrIds.label: Names or IDs
namesOrIds.description: are the input pathways input as pathway names or as pathway ids of genes and metabolites

maxPathwaySize.label: Max Pathway Size
maxPathwaySize.description: (default Inf), trims returned results to pathways that have fewer than this number

requestBody.description: Perform pathway enrichment on metabolites or metabolites/genes/proteins.   Prepend IDs by source ID type (e.g. hmdb:HMDB0240254).

analytes.description: Prepend IDs by source ID type (e.g. hmdb:HMDB0240254)

background.label: Background Biospecimen
background.description: For analyses with metabolites only as input: select tissue-specific background to be used for enrichment analyses.  All RaMP metabolites are used as default.

backgroundFile.label: Custom Background
backgroundFile.description: Supply excel file containing custom pathway definitions. Pathways should be defined in the GMX format. GMX files contain one analyte set per column, with the name of the set in the first row, and constituent analytes in subsequent rows. The first sheet of the excel file should contain metabolite pathway definitions, while the second sheet should contain gene pathway definitions. Take care to ensure that analyte identifiers used to define pathways are the same as the identifiers used in the dataset.

requestBody.description: Retrieve ontology(ies) from input analyte(s).  Prepend IDs by source ID type (e.g. hmdb:HMDB0240254).

metabolites.description: Input analyte IDs prepended by source ID type (one per line or comma separated)

post.summary: Retrieve Metabolites From Input Ontology names.  The ontologies are derived from HMDB.

requestBody.description: Search for an ontology and download all analytes that belong to that ontology.

ontology.description: a vector of ontology or ontologies delimited by new line character

requestBody.description: RaMP-DB performs ontology enrichment analysis using Fisher’s tests. ID types must be prepended (e.g., chebi:58115)

post.summary: Retrieve Analytes Involved in the Same Reaction

requestBody.description: Input analytes and retrieve analytes all other analytes that belong to the same reaction. IDs should be prepended by ID source (e.g. **hmdb**:C00412).

analytes.description: a vector of analytes that need to be searched

post.summary: Retrieve Reaction Classes from Input Analytes

requestBody.description: Retrieve Rhea reaction classes and Enzyme Commission numbers (EC numbers) for enzymes.  Users can input metabolites as ChEBI ids or genes/proteins as UniProt IDs.  No other ID types are supported and ID types must be prepended (e.g., chebi:58115)

multiRxnParticipantCount.description: minimum number of analytes to report a reaction class, default = 1
multiRxnParticipantCount.label: Reaction Analyte Counts

humanProtein.description: require reactions to have a human protein (enzyme or transporter), default True
humanProtein.label: Human Protein in Reaction

concatResults.description: returns all reaction class levels in one dataframe rather than a list of 3 dataframes
concatResults.label: Concatenate Results

includeReactionIDs.description: adds the list of reaction ids for each reaction class
includeReactionIDs.label: Include Reaction IDs

useIdMapping.description: allows one to fuzzy match input ids to chebi and uniprot to support reaction queries.
useIdMapping.label: Use ID Mapping

post.summary: Return reactions from a given list of analytes

requestBody.description: Return information on curated reactions from Rhea.  Users can input metabolites as ChEBI ids or genes/proteins as UniProt IDs.  No other ID types are supported and ID types must be prepended (e.g., chebi:58115).

analytes.description: list of analytes. Only CHEBI and Uniprot IDs are supported

onlyHumanMets.description: boolean to only return pathways containing only human metabolites (ChEBI ontology)
onlyHumanMets.label: Human Metabolites Only

humanProtein.description: boolean to only control pathways catalyzed by a human proteins (having human Uniprot)
humanProtein.label: Human Protein Pathways Only

includeTransportRxns.description: if TRUE, returns metabolic and transport reactions
includeTransportRxns.label: Include Transport Reactions

rxnDirs.description: character vector of length > 1, specifying reaction directions to return.
rxnDirs.label: Reaction Directions

includeRxnURLs.description: if TRUE, urls to Rhea.org will be delivered in the result dataframe for each reaction
includeRxnURLs.label: Include Reaction URLs

requestBody.description: Return enriched Rhea reaction classes. Users can input metabolites as ChEBI ids or genes/proteins as UniProt IDs.  No other ID types are supported and ID types must be prepended (e.g., chebi:58115)

post.summary: Retrieve Chemical Classes from Input Metabolites

requestBody.description: Retrieve chemical class information from input analyte(s).  Prepend IDs by source ID type (e.g. hmdb:HMDB0240254).

metabolites.description: a list object of source prepended metaboite ids, representing a metabolite set of interest

requestBody.description: RaMP-DB performs chemical class enrichment analysis using Fisher’s tests. The function performs enrichment analysis for Classyfire classes, sub-classess, and super-classes, and for LipidMaps categories, main classes, and sub classes.

metabolites.description: a vector of source prepended metabolite ids

backgroundFile.label: Custom Background
backgroundFile.description: Supply excel file containing custom pathway definitions. Pathways should be defined in the GMX format. GMX files contain one analyte set per column, with the name of the set in the first row, and constituent analytes in subsequent rows. The first sheet of the excel file should contain metabolite pathway definitions, while the second sheet should contain gene pathway definitions. Take care to ensure that analyte identifiers used to define pathways are the same as the identifiers used in the dataset.

post.summary: Retrieve Chemical Properties from Input Metabolites

requestBody.description: Chemical properties captured by RaMP-DB include SMILES, InChI, InChI-keys, monoisotopic masses, molecular formula, and common name. Prepend metabolite IDs by source ID type (e.g. hmdb:HMDB0240254).

metabolites.description: a list object of source prepended metaboite ids, representing a metabolite set of interest

propertyList.label: Property List
propertyList.description: an optional list of specific properties to extract. Options include 'all' (default), 'smiles', 'inchi_key', 'inchi_key_prefix', 'inchi', 'mw', 'monoisotop_mass', 'formula', 'common_name'. If a props list is not supplied, all property fields will be returned.

post.summary: Filter the Results of the Enrichment Tests

requestBody.description: Filter Pathway Enrichment. This is primarily used after running `combined-fisher-test` as the required input is the output from that call.

pValType.label: P-Value Type
pValType.description: Select whether nominal p-values or p-values corrected for multiple comparisons should be used to filter results

pValCutoff.label: P-Value Cutoff
pValCutoff.description: Select statistical threshold cutoff - pathways with p-values > cutoff will be removed from results

minAnalyte.label: Minumum Analytes
minAnalyte.description: Define minAnalyte,  the minimum number of user input analytes within a pathway.  Pathways that include < minAnalyte will be filtered out.

fishresults.pathwayName: Amino acid metabolism pathway excerpt: histidine catabolism extension
Urea cycle and metabolism of amino groups
NAD metabolism in oncogene-induced senescence and mitochondrial dysfunction-associated senescence

fishresults.analytes: CARN; Carnosine;Argininosuccinic acid;Citric acid;L-Alanine;L-Asparagine;L-Aspartic acid;(3R)-3-acetyloxy-4-(trimethylazaniumyl)butanoate; L-Acetylcarnitine; O-Acetylcarnitine;GOT1;GOT2;AGXT;GPT

fishresults.pathwayName: mRNA, protein, and metabolite inducation pathway by cyclosporin A

post.summary: Return clustered Fisher's test results from given list of Fisher's test results

requestBody.description: Cluster Pathway Enrichment. This is primarily used after running `combined-fisher-test` or `filter-fisher-test` as the required input is the output from that call. Uses the findCluster agglomerative clustering method from the R package (see documentation for more details).

minPathwayToCluster.label: Minimum Pathways in Cluster
minPathwayToCluster.description: Minimum number of 'similar' pathways required to start a cluster (medoid) (Default = 2)

percAnalyteOverlap.label: Analyte Overlap Percentage
percAnalyteOverlap.description: Minimum overlap for pathways to be considered similar (Default = 0.2)

percPathwayOverlap.label: Pathway Overlap Percentage
percPathwayOverlap.description: Minimum overlap for clusters to merge (Default = 0.2)

fishers_results.label: The full result object generated by runEnrichPathways

fishresults.pathwayName: Amino acid metabolism pathway excerpt: histidine catabolism extension
Urea cycle and metabolism of amino groups
NAD metabolism in oncogene-induced senescence and mitochondrial dysfunction-associated senescence

fishresults.analytes: CARN; Carnosine;Argininosuccinic acid;Citric acid;L-Alanine;L-Asparagine;L-Aspartic acid;(3R)-3-acetyloxy-4-(trimethylazaniumyl)butanoate; L-Acetylcarnitine; O-Acetylcarnitine;GOT1;GOT2;AGXT;GPT

fishresults.pathwayName: mRNA, protein, and metabolite inducation pathway by cyclosporin A

post.x-HTMLDescription: The R package and vignette are open-source and freely available at our GitHub site.

requestBody.description: MetLinkR automatically cross-links metabolite identifiers across multiple studies and attributes them a common name. MetLinkR runs in minutes and allows for simultaneous querying of 6 commonly reported identifier types. It is recommended that users inspect outputs to ensure that mappings maintain the desired level of chemical structural resolution.

backgroundFile.label: Input Files
backgroundFile.description: Supply excel file containing custom pathway definitions. Pathways should be defined in the GMX format. GMX files contain one analyte set per column, with the name of the set in the first row, and constituent analytes in subsequent rows. The first sheet of the excel file should contain metabolite pathway definitions, while the second sheet should contain gene pathway definitions. Take care to ensure that analyte identifiers used to define pathways are the same as the identifiers used in the dataset.

manifestFile.label: Manifest File
manifestFile.description: CSV file to describe the metadata provided for the metabolite entities from the input files.
